definition: a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

sentences.english: In addition, he turned the justice anti-invasion war into absurdly indiscriminate rejection of everything foreign.
sentences.chinese: 把正义的反侵略的爱国主义变成了荒谬的盲目排外。

sentences.english: He appealed to his country's nativism.
sentences.chinese: 他求助于这个国家的排外主义。

sentences.english: This also eliminates the I in Shanghai people cheat strangers and xenophobic stereotypes.
sentences.chinese: 从此也消除了我对上海人欺生和排外的成见。

sentences.english: The Afghans I met were neither xenophobic nor bellicose.
sentences.chinese: 我遇到的阿富汗人既不排外，也不好战。

sentences.english: Macrosomia should be suspected in all postdates gestations.
sentences.chinese: 过期妊娠需排外巨大儿的发生。

sentences.english: I was closed to anything that smacked of spirituality and religion.
sentences.chinese: 只要是沾上灵性和宗教的东西我都排外。

sentences.english: And this is part of what ancient religion was like, is that people were not exclusive.
sentences.chinese: 古代宗教的特点之一，就是人们并不排外。

sentences.english: The exclusive nature of the G7 and G8 cannot be overcome just with economic power.
sentences.chinese: 仅凭经济实力不足以克服G7和G8的排外性。

sentences.english: He was also a natural populist in a field that was sniffy and exclusive, bringing to the Met and Covent Garden a sense of opera as Italian peasant fare, “macaroni” for the masses.
sentences.chinese: 他也是这个自大并排外的圈子里面天然的平民主义者。

sentences.english: It should be noted that the various mechanisms are not at all exclusive.
sentences.chinese: 应当注意到，不同的机制并不完全是排外的。

sentences.english: There was no hiding it -- I was a clueless literary xenophobe.
sentences.chinese: 没有隐藏，我是一个无能的文学排外。

sentences.english: Results OHCs of group A arranged tidily in three rows and showed characteristic V-arranged stereocilia.
sentences.chinese: 结果谷胱甘肽组耳蜗三排外毛细胞呈V字型排列有序。

definition: to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to feel animosity toward foreigners or outsiders/xenophobia
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
discrimination (against sb)/also written 歧視|歧视
to reject/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to repel
to hate to leave a place where one has lived long/to be attached to one's native land and unwilling to leave it
to revere everything foreign and pander to overseas powers (idiom); blind worship of foreign goods and ideas
